## What is SQL?

Structured Query Language - the standard for relational databases.

## Why SQL?

- Universal database language
- Query data efficiently
- Essential for data work
- Foundation for analytics

## SQL Operations

| Category | Commands |
|----------|----------|
| Query | SELECT |
| Modify | INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE |
| Define | CREATE, ALTER, DROP |

slides.title: SELECT Statement
slides.content:
# SELECT Statement ğŸ”

## Basic Syntax

```sql
SELECT column1, column2
FROM table_name
WHERE condition
ORDER BY column1;
```

## Examples

```sql
-- All columns
SELECT * FROM customers;

-- Specific columns
SELECT name, email FROM customers;

-- With condition
SELECT * FROM orders WHERE amount > 100;
```

> ğŸ¯ SELECT is your primary data retrieval tool!

slides.title: Joins
slides.content:
# SQL Joins ğŸ”—

## Types of Joins

| Join | Returns |
|------|--------|
| INNER | Matching rows only |
| LEFT | All left + matching right |
| RIGHT | All right + matching left |
| FULL | All rows from both |

## Syntax

```sql
SELECT o.id, c.name
FROM orders o
INNER JOIN customers c
ON o.customer_id = c.id;
```

> ğŸ’¡ Joins combine tables for analysis!

slides.title: Aggregations
slides.content:
# Aggregations ğŸ“Š

## Aggregate Functions

| Function | Purpose |
|----------|--------|
| COUNT() | Count rows |
| SUM() | Total |
| AVG() | Average |
| MIN()/MAX() | Extremes |

## GROUP BY

```sql
SELECT category, SUM(sales)
FROM products
GROUP BY category
HAVING SUM(sales) > 1000;
```

> ğŸ¯ Aggregations summarize data!
